page.title: 07FARMING IN HALWELL&MORELEIGH
page.content: Renowned for cream,famous for lamb,our farmers continue the traditions. An annual rainfall exceeding 125cms pa. & over 1650 hours sunshine pa. gives the area a growing season in excess of 330 days pa.-ideal for intensive grass cultivation on medium loam soil. The average farm size is 230 acres,some given over to barley,kale and beet for Winter feed. Cattle, more beef now since the introduction of milk quotas,are mainly Fresian,plus Devon Reds and Charolais. Sheep are bred for wool and meat. Milk is collected daily for the processing plant and animals are sold at one of several local markets. There is small scale vegetable growing,a ready local demand for free range eggs and pig breeding is on the increase. Farms are mainly family affairs,with the number of employees diminishing yearly.
